body.p:
To His Excellency James. F. Robinson. Governor of Kentucky -- The undersigned George A. Bowyer a citizen of Lexington Ky, would respectfully represent, that a Judgment was rendered against him before the Presiding Judge of the Pulaski County ^on 20 June 1863^ for $100. and cost; ^on charge of pedling without license^ He states, that he had been engaged for some time ^past^ in furnishing military goods to the Division of the Army stationed at Somerset Ky, and not thinking that it was necessary to take out license for that purpose, as I was a bone fide resident and merchant tailor of Lexington Ky. come down to this town for the above stated purpose -- Understanding ^Shortly after I reached this place^ there might possibly be some difficulty in this matter I went the the Presiding Judge, and made a full and fair statement of the whole case to him, and promised, if he should so advise to send to Lexington for license, which I did very soon after having this conversation with him, but the application was refused because I was not personally in court, in the meantime the warrant was sued out against me, and a judgment rendered as above stated -- It is my intention to take out license if I continue to furnish goods to the army, and would ask the interposition of Executive clemency to save me of this, as I think, unjust fine and punishment -- etc. I did do wrong, it was not with the intent to evade the law, but thro my ignorance of the legal technicalities necessary to be observed in the matter --
And I will state to your Honor that no warrant would have been issued against me, had not some evil disposed person circulated to my injury, that I intend to leave the country on short notice to avoid the prosecution, -- which statement was entirely false -- As a proof of its falsity, the notice of the refusal of the Fayette Clerk to issue me a license never reached here until the warrant was issued -- & I herewith enclose the letter I recd from my agent in Lexington conveying to me that information,

We concur in the above statement --
E L Van Winkle
W. McKee Fox
I would respectfully recomend the release setting aside The fine of G A Bowyer

J Halfro
Bond of " at Lexington Ky
June 2 1863

Pulaski Cir. Ct
$100 } Pedling
Fine remitted
J F Robinson
Geo. A. Bowyer
Issd June 25. 1863.
